articles.title: DPRK Will Join UNESCO and Other Member States in Efforts to Achieve Sustainable Development Goals
articles.content:
DPRK Will Join UNESCO and Other Member States in Efforts to Achieve Sustainable Development Goals
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The head of the DPRK delegation made a speech at the Nov. 3 plenum of the 39th session of the General Conference of the UNESCO being held in Paris from Oct. 30 to Nov. 14.
					 It is the noble mission of UNESCO to build peace in mind of men and women, thus contributing to the peace, security and prosperity of the world, he said, and went on:
					
					 SDGs can be achieved successfully only when all the countries and nations are engaged collectively. And therefore, it requires the international cooperation and collaboration to be further strengthened.
					
					 Yet, the efforts of UNESCO and the international community to build a peaceful and civilized world aspired by the humankind are faced with serious challenges.
					
					 In accordance with the constant policy of the DPR Korea Government to attach great importance to education and science, universal 12-year compulsory education system has been enforced since 2014.
					
					 Higher education system and pedagogical education system are improved and national distant education system and sci-tech network are greatly enhanced as required by the new century, thus the quality of the national education has been further improved.
					
					 The Government of the DPR Korea has set forth the target of the building sci-tech power to put the national science and technology on the cutting-edge level of the world and to develop all the sectors by the pivotal role of science and technology. 
					
					 Research and developments are actively conducted to surpass the cutting-edge, making a great contribution to the power of the country and improvement of people's livelihood.  
					
					 Such struggle of the Korean people is taking place amidst sanctions of the U.S. and its following forces.
					
					 The U.S threats and sanctions to stifle our sovereignty as well as right to existence and right to development give huge negative effects not only on education, science and ICT but also even on sports and everyday life of the people.
					
					 Such acts against humanity and civilization which destroy the modern civilization should be put to an end at once. 
					
					 Despite of the current difficult situation and condition, the Korean people will continue their energetic struggle to build the civilized nation and to achieve the SDGs with the great driving force of self-reliance and self-development and with the strength of science and technology.
					
					 The DPR Korea will, in the future, too, further strengthen and develop international cooperation and solidarity under its foreign policy ideals of independence, peace and friendship and actively join UNESCO and other member states in their efforts to achieve Sustainable Development Goals.

articles.title: DPRK Proves Successful at 2017 Grand Prix Diving Game
articles.content:
DPRK Proves Successful at 2017 Grand Prix Diving Game
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK players proved successful at the 2017 Grand Prix Diving Game sponsored by the International Federation of Swimming.
					 Taking part in the game held in Singapore on Nov. 3-5 were more than 50 men and women players from 15 countries and regions including Russia, China, UK and Germany.
					
					 Kim Mi Hwa and Kim Kwang Hui of the DPRK placed first at the diving women's 10 meter synchro platform event.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Football League to Be Held
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Football League to Be Held
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The 2017-2018 DPRK Premier Football League is to be held, said Kim Chang Bok, department director of the DPRK Football Association.
					 According to him, the league will be attended by April 25, Kigwancha, Amnokgang, Pyongyang, Sobaeksu, Rimyongsu, Hwaebul, Ryomyong, Sonbong, Wolmido, Jebi and Kalmaegi teams and the team of the Ministry of Light Industry.
					
					 The league will start on December 1, 2017 and continue till October 28, 2018.
					
					 Two top teams in the final team standings will be qualified for the AFC Cup-2019.

articles.title: Mud Products Favorable for Improving Health Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Mud Products Favorable for Improving Health Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Kwangryangman Sulphur Mud Processing Factory has recently developed over 10 kinds of functional mud products to be conducive to the improvement of people's health.
					 Those products are made of effectual materials of nutritive and pharmacological value extracted from sulfur mud at high rate by means of latest engineering method.
					
					 Typical of them is sauna gel, a mixture of extracts from sulfur mud and Koryo medicines, which has been highly appreciated by users for having clear effects of eliminating waste matters from human body, sweating easily and promoting blood circulation.
					
					 It is said that all the products have been proved effective by different medical institutions.
					
					 Ri Man Gon, manager of the factory, said that sulfur mud abundant in the west coastal Kwangryang Bay is estimated to be superior among different kinds of curative mud in the world, adding that the new mud products have won high appraisal at home and abroad.

articles.title: Nuclear War Maniacs Will Face Strong Retaliation: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Nuclear War Maniacs Will Face Strong Retaliation: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Trump group is again speaking of possibility of "preemptive nuclear attack" on the DPRK.
					 At a hearing on the right to use the military force of the president held at the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on Oct. 30, Secretary of Defense Mattis and Secretary of State Tillerson said Trump has the right to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK without a parliamentary approval.
					
					 They said that in case of north Korea, action can come first before notifying Congress as what was done to Syria as it would be a direct imminent and actual attack on the U.S. They even blustered that if other country is ready to use weapons of mass destruction against the U.S., the situation of ordering to mount a preemptive nuclear attack is imaginable.
					
					 Furthermore, they stated that no president renounced the right to mount a preemptive attack and Trump can also exercise the right legally granted to him as a man with the full command of the armed forces.
					
					 The essence of wild bluffing made by Mattis and Tillerson is that the U.S. can mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK without parliamentary approval in case Trump deems it necessary.
					
					 Those rhetoric uttered by diplomatic and security chiefs reflective of the U.S. wild ambition for a preemptive nuclear attack is an extremely serious provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 No U.S. administration openly claimed preemptive attack on the DPRK as now, an indication that the nuclear threat and blackmail of the Trump group has reached the phase of reckless implementation.
					
					 At a time when even U.S. Congress is getting vocal calling for depriving thoughtless lunatic Trump of the right to decide a preemptive attack, the Defense and State secretaries supported him. This speaks volumes for the Trump administration's attempt at invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 Their wild rhetoric about "preemptive nuclear attack" on the DPRK clearly proved once again that the DPRK was quite right when it opted for nuclear access and it is the path it has to follow to the last.
					
					 Now that the U.S. disclosed its attempt at a preemptive attack on the DPRK, we will face it and strongly react to it with the tremendous nuclear force it has so far built.
					
					 It will be the U.S. which is to entirely blame for any ensuing consequences in case a war breaks out on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Fundamental Step Is Needed to Clear U.S. of Worries: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Fundamental Step Is Needed to Clear U.S. of Worries: KCNA Commentary 
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- There is strong movement to restrict Trump's right to the use of force in the U.S.
					 On October 26, 62 members of the House of Representatives of the U.S. submitted a "No Unconstitutional Strike Against North Korea Act" meant to prevent Trump from mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK without an approval by Congress, and senators also plan to enact a similar act.
					
					 The ex-presidents and former officials of the Defense Department, State Intelligence Agency and Central Intelligence Agency and the White House call for restraining the right to use force granted to Trump, being worried that he may cause a big trouble and he is not aware of the damage his utterance may bring.
					
					 The New York Times, the Washington Post and other major media call for the institution of a relevant law, and organizations even file lawsuits against the Trump administration.
					
					 It is the first time in the U.S. history that the political and social circles of the country all rose up, calling for the restriction of the president's right to the use of force.
					
					 This shows that Trump's bellicose outpourings and war hysteria have reached the phase which can no longer be overlooked.
					
					 The U.S. is now thrown into extreme uneasiness due to Trump's behavior reminiscent of a mentally deranged man.
					
					 His impudent acts of pushing the situation to the extremes while crying out for a "military solution" and "total destruction" have created the situation in which a nuclear war may break out any moment. The American society is of the same opinion that this has to be stopped.
					
					 The chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee expressed concerns, saying that the president is a clear and present danger who is mentally unstable.
					
					 Recently the CNN recalled how President Nixon was deterred from going riot to start a nuclear war while showing the symptom of mental derangement at the end of having a hard time due to the "Watergate incident" in the 1970s. This can be seen as a reflection of the atmosphere pervading the U.S.
					
					 The responsibility for putting under control the present worst situation entirely rests with the U.S.
					
					 Will it be possible to deter the frenzy of old lunatic just by restraining him from exercising the right to use of force.
					
					 A fundamental solution is to dismiss him from office, a man branded as a "substantially dangerous being invested with the right to press the nuclear button", and for the U.S. to withdraw the hostile policy toward the DPRK. Otherwise, the U.S. and the whole world can suffer from the nuclear war nightmare.
					
					 If the U.S. does not want to face a horrible nuclear disaster and tragic end, it had better pay heed to the advice of the international community.

articles.title: DPRK Will Finally Conclude Showdown with U.S. to Victory: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Finally Conclude Showdown with U.S. to Victory: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Trump group has driven the tensions in the Korean peninsula to the extremes, crying out for what they call "military option" against the DPRK.
					 U.S. nuclear-powered carrier strike groups massed in the waters off the Korean peninsula while the secretary of Defense and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the U.S. visited south Korea to have discussion with the puppet forces on the "military counteraction".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in an article Monday says that no one can predict when the lunatic old man of the White House, lost to senses, will start a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 A touch-and-go situation is prevailing in the peninsula due to the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces' military provocations.
					
					 The situation strongly requires us to bolster up the nuclear deterrent for self-defense in every way to cope with the vicious moves of the enemies to isolate and stifle the DPRK, holding fast to the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 No matter how desperately the enemies may work, the army and people of the DPRK remain steadfast in their faith and will to successfully accomplish the historic cause of building the state nuclear force.
					
					 The U.S. should not expect us to make any change.
					
					 No matter what storm and stress and ordeals the army and people of the DPRK may face, they will pave a broad avenue to the independent development and prosperity, holding fast to the nuclear deterrent of justice.
					
					 The more serious the situation may become and the worse challenge and ordeals lie before us, we will conclude the showdown with the U.S. to victory in the offensive spirit.

articles.title: S. Korean Defense Minister's Remarks Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Defense Minister's Remarks Denounced
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Traitor Song Yong Mu, puppet defense minister of south Korea, unhesitatingly spat out such reckless remarks as "collapse of the north" at the recent "parliamentary inspection of the administration".
					 Song was the first one who talked about "collapse of the north" since the appearance of the present authorities of south Korea, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary.
					
					 Branding his reckless remarks as intolerable mud-slinging at the dignity and social system of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, the commentary goes on:
					
					 Song, steeped in flunkeyism and treachery to the marrow of his bones, is a poor lackey of the U.S. prolonging his remaining days by serving the U.S. master. How can such stooge point an accusing finger at the dignity of the DPRK?
					
					 He seems like a dog barking together with its master. When the old lunatic of the White House vociferated about "total destruction", "the only one effective way" and "full readiness", Song ran amuck to echo what his master raved.
					
					 The north-south relations have not freed from the catastrophe and the situation on the Korean peninsula is driven to an extreme pitch of tension although the conservative regime was replaced by the new one as the vicious confrontation maniacs like Song are allowed to ride roughshod in the present south Korean regime.
					
					 It is urgent to throw overboard such traitors obsessed with confrontation at any cost. If such hooligans spitting out a flurry of invective against the DPRK are allowed to go scot-free, a war would break out finally.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should behave themselves, bearing in mind that they would suffer a big disaster owing to such fools as Song who cannot hold their tongues.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Is Symbol of All Victories of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Is Symbol of All Victories of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign media have given wide publicity to the news that respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un recently inspected the remodeled Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory, describing it as a manifestation of his pluck as a great man born of Heaven and his leadership traits, says Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Monday.
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The respected Supreme Leader, who gives field guidance to factories and co-op farms in the most imperturbable and stately manners even under the touch-and-go situation, is the symbol of our all victories.
					
					 The lesson the Korean people drew from the complicated international situation is that the destiny of a country and nation entirely depends on whether it is led by an outstanding leader or not and that it would be impossible to defend the security and sovereignty of a nation without tremendous military capability.
					
					 Without his distinguished leadership and the socialist system, our country would have been a bargaining chip of big powers and fallen a victim to the invasion by the barbarous U.S. imperialists in the present serious and complicated situation as it is situated in the geopolitically important position.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists try to test the DPRK with the same logic of strength as applied to some countries, this will end up accelerating their doom.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will continue to fully display their indomitable spirit to foil the reckless nuclear war moves and harsh sanctions and pressure of the U.S. and other hostile forces and proudly build a powerful socialist country under the unfurled banner of the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts, single-mindedly united around their Supreme Leader.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Warmonger Trump
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Warmonger Trump
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Warmonger Trump started his Asia visit. Ahead of his Asia visit, his clans vociferated about reckless remarks extremely aggravating the tension on the Korean peninsula.
					 At a recent interview with Fox News, Trump said the U.S. is incredibly well prepared to cope with the "north's provocation".
					
					 U.S. Secretary of Defense Mattis said the DPRK would face a large and overwhelming military counteraction if it uses nuclear weapons. Timed to coincide with this, the U.S. military warlike forces sent nuclear carriers task forces to the waters off the Korean peninsula for large military drills, talking about "military option".
					
					 All these facts are the very dangerous developments showing that the U.S. is going to ignite a war on the Korean peninsula at any cost, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Tragedy is that Trump, accustomed to getting money by cajoling other people, recklessly mulls playing a nuclear war gambling while despising the opponent. 
					
					 It is ridiculous that Trump is going to boast of the muscle regarding the nuclear strategic assets as his belongings for Asia visit.
					
					 Trump can never browbeat the army and people of the DPRK with such nuclear strategic assets. If the Trump group dares try to topple down the DPRK, its army will never pardon the enemies.
					
					 It is the strong will of all the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK to wipe out the bulwark of aggression and annihilate the enemies to prevent something crazy with striking power unimaginable in the world.
					
					 The Trump group would be well advised to behave themselves after thinking twice about the catastrophic consequences of their reckless war hysteria.

articles.title: Anti-U.S., Anti-War Actions Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S., Anti-War Actions Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Actions were reportedly launched all at once in different parts of south Korea on Nov. 4 in protest against war maniac Trump's visit to south Korea and in demand of the removal of evils of the conservative forces.
					 All-people rallies against Trump's visit took place in Seoul, Taejon, Taegu, Pusan, Ulsan, south Korean Kangwon, North Jolla and South Kyongsang provinces and other parts at the same time under the sponsorship of the Anti-Trump Joint Action grouping more than 220 political parties and organizations.
					
					 The participants in the rally held in Jongro District of Seoul said actions are taking place in all parts of south Korea and that international solidarity actions are being held in Washington, New York, Canada, Germany and Tokyo, expressing the will to energetically struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the rally.
					
					 The participants were informed of solidarity letters from civic and public organizations of the U.S., Japan and other countries.
					
					 They marched toward the U.S. embassy, chanting such slogans as "No war threat, No sale of weapons, No brigandish pressure on  trade and No Trump's visit" and "No escalation of tension on Korean peninsula."
					
					 They held a protest rally in front of the U.S. embassy and scattered over its fence literature reading "Warmonger Trump, don't come" and others.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Minjung Party held a meeting outside the U.S. embassy.
					
					 The "youth expedition group visiting U.S. for impeachment of Trump" held the "rally for totally destroying Trump".

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Blasts Chief Executive's "Policy Speech
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Blasts Chief Executive's "Policy Speech"
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo on Nov. 3 carried an editorial condemning the "policy speech" made by the present chief executive at the "National Assembly" Wednesday.
					 The "speech" convinced the people that the "government" has neither ability nor will to settle the war crisis, the editorial said.
					
					 Should the chief executive blindly follow the war policy of lunatic Trump, his fate will be the same as that of Trump, it stated, urging the "government" to cherish the lesson of history that cooperation with foreign forces would end in the war and self-destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Youth and Students Stage Surprise Demonstration against Trump's Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Youth and Students Stage Surprise Demonstration against Trump's Visit 
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- South Korean youth and students on Nov. 3 staged a surprise demonstration against Trump's visit to south Korea outside the building of the puppet National Assembly, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 The participants in the demonstration opposed Trump's visit to south Korea aimed to increase the danger of a war, force south Korea to buy weapons and put trade pressure.
					
					 They urged Trump to make an apology for his utterances bringing about the crisis of a war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 If Trump plans to make a speech at the NA, he should promise the peace on the peninsula and if he tries to urge south Korea to ignite a war, he should not visit south Korea, they noted.
					
					 When they attempted to go inside the NA, fascist policemen walked away 25 persons.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Oppose Trump's Visits to Japan, S. Korea
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Oppose Trump's Visits to Japan, S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Association for Democracy and Unification of South Koreans in Japan (Hanthongryon) and other organizations of Koreans in Japan staged a protest against Trump's visits to Japan and south Korea and its aggressive war moves against the DPRK together with Japanese civic and public organizations outside the U.S. embassy in Tokyo on Nov. 3, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 The demonstrators sniped at Trump for planning to prepare a war against the DPRK together with Japan during his visit and promote his war policy during his visit to south Korea.
					
					 At the protest a written protest sent by Hanthongryon to Trump and a joint statement by110 civic and public organizations of Koreans in Japan and Japanese were issued.
					
					 The participants thrust the written protest and joint statement into the U.S. embassy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Introduced by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Introduced by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website on Oct. 27 the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of DPRK to Be Celebrated in Peru
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of DPRK to Be Celebrated in Peru
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian committee for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the DPRK was formed on Oct. 31.
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to let various political parties and organizations of Peru hold colorful events of friendship and solidarity with the Korean people, intensify the publicity activities through internet and thus raise the voices supporting the DPRK among the Peruvian people.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Figure Supports DPRK's Stand
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Figure Supports DPRK's Stand
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League who is a lawyer of the Supreme Court of Bangladesh, called for organizing an international forum of lawyers for clarifying the legal grounds of the UN Security Council's unreasonable "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK.
					 He said in a statement on Nov. 1:
					
					 The UNSC adopted "sanctions resolutions", terming the DPRK's nuclear tests and ICBM test-fires "threats to global peace."
					
					 But no paragraph in the UN Charter and any international codes specify such actions as threats to global peace and security.
					
					 The UNSC, which is obliged to act true to the UN mission of guaranteeing global peace and security, can table issues only when they are confirmed that a country wrecked peace and invaded another country.
					
					 Progressive lawyers in Bangladesh call for organizing an international forum of lawyers to clarify the legal grounds of the UNSC's anti-DPRK "sanctions resolutions."

articles.title: El jefe de delegacion coreana expresa la decision de cooperar con UNESCO
articles.content:
El jefe de delegacion coreana expresa la decision de cooperar con UNESCO
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El jefe de la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo uso de la palabra el dia 3 en la reunion plenaria de la 39a sesion de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO), que tiene lugar del 30 de octubre al 14 de noviembre en Paris de Francia.
					Contribuir a la paz, la seguridad y la prosperidad del mundo al sembrar el espiritu de la paz en el alma de las personas es la mision noble de la UNESCO, enfatizo y subrayo que se enfrentan con graves desafios los esfuerzos de la UNESCO y la comunidad internacional por construir un mundo pacifico y civilizado a que aspira toda la humanidad.
					
					La meta de desarrollo sostenible se puede conseguir exitosamente solo cuando todos los paises y naciones del mundo participen con el alma comun y para el fin necesita el fortalecimiento de las cooperaciones internacionales, insistio y continuo:
					
					Segun las politicas del gobierno de dar prioridad a la educacion y a las ciencias, se implemento en la RPDC desde el ano 2014 la ensenanza obligatoria general de doce anos, se mejoro el sistema de educacion superior y pedagogica y se perfeccionaron mas el sistema de tele-educacion y el intranet de divulgacion de las ciencias y tecnicas conforme a la demanda de nuevo siglo.
					
					El gobierno de la RPDC trazo una meta de construccion de la potencia cientifico-tecnica para poner en el nivel mundial las ciencias y tecnicas del pais y desarrollar todos los sectores del pais basandose en ellas. Mediante las dinamicas campanas de investigacion cientifica se va fortaleciendo el poderio del Estado y mejorando la vida del pueblo.
					
					Tales esfuerzos del pueblo coreano se llevan adelante superando la sancion de EE.UU. y sus satelites.
					
					La amenaza y sancion de EE.UU. para exterminar la soberania y los derechos a la subsistencia y al desarrollo de nuestro pais dan una gran influencia negativa tanto a los dominios de educacion, ciencia y comunicaciones informaticas como a la rama deportiva y la vida cotidiana de los habitantes coreanos.
					
					Deben ser cesados ahora mismo los actos antieticos y anti-civilizados, destinados a destruir la civilizacion moderna.
					
					Aunque son muy dificiles el ambiente y las condiciones de hoy, el pueblo coreano continuara vigorosamente la lucha por edificar la potencia civilizada y alcanzar la meta de desarrollo sostenible, dando prueba del autofortalecimiento y el poderio de las ciencias y tecnicas.
					
					Al igual que en el pasado, bajo el ideal de la politica exterior de independencia, paz y amistad, el gobierno de la RPDC estrechara aun mas la cooperacion y la unidad internacionales y se incorporara activamente a los esfuerzos de la UNESCO y sus paises miembros por lograr la meta de desarrollo sostenible.

articles.title: Jugadoras coreanas ganan medalla de oro en competencia internacional de clavado
articles.content:
Jugadoras coreanas ganan medalla de oro en competencia internacional de clavado
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Las jugadoras coreanas Kim Mi Hwa y Kim Kwang Hui conquistaron la medalla de oro en el salto simultaneo desde la plataforma fija de 10m de la Competencia de Clavado Grand Prix de 2017, auspiciada por la Federacion Internacional de Natacion.
					En este torneo, transcurrido del dia 3 al 5 en Singapur, compitieron mas de 50 jugadores de ambos sexos de 15 paises y regiones como Rusia, China, Gran Bretana y Alemania.

articles.title: Se entablara en Corea el torneo de futbol de categoria A
articles.content:
Se entablara en Corea el torneo de futbol de categoria A
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Se desarrollara el torneo de futbol de categoria A de 2017-2018 de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Asi subrayo a la ACNC Kim Chang Bok, director de la Asociacion de Futbol de Corea, y continuo:
					
					A la cita deportiva asistiran 13 equipos que obtuvieron la calidad de clubes de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol, tales como 25 de Abril, Kigwancha, Amnokgang, Pyongyang, Sobaeksu, Rimyongsu, Hwaebul, Ryomyong, Sonbong, Wolmido, Kalmaegi, Ministerio de Industria Ligera y Jebi.
					
					El torneo se realizara del primero del diciembre de 2017 al 28 de octubre de 2018 y cada equipo jugara con su rival en sus respectivas casas.
					
					Los dos equipos sobresalientes ganaran boletos a la Copa de la CAF que tendra lugar en el 2019.
					
					Los especialistas y aficionados preven que cada competencia del torneo sera mas interesante y renida.
